Procedural_Context: Judicial review of PRRA refusal and deferral denials
Credibility_Assessment: Applicant's evidence deemed insufficient to establish personalized risk
Evidence_Type: Police convocation notice, articles on prisoner treatment
Basis_of_Claim: Risk of persecution in Senegal due to past incidents
Evaluation_Standard: Personalized risk assessment based on new evidence
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Lack of sufficient evidence to demonstrate individualized risk
Regulation_Cited: Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations (IRPR), Section 222
Assessment_Standard: Reasonableness standard applied to administrative decision
Application_Factor: New evidence must show personal risk upon return
Decision_Outcome: PRRA application refused, removal not deferred
Decision_Review_Issue: Whether the PRRA Officer properly assessed new evidence
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: PRRA process requirements under IRPA and IRPR
Cause_of_Refusal: Insufficient evidence of personalized risk upon return to Senegal
Evidentiary_Issues: Generic country condition reports not enough without personalization
Credibility_Issues: No explicit finding of dishonesty, but lack of compelling evidence
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Application for judicial review challenging reasonableness
